title: METAL GEAR RISING: REVENGEANCE
notes: Runs without any noticable issues, unless you switch to another window and back again while running the game fullscreen, which causes the game to freeze. Running in a wine virtual desktop fixes this.

title: METAL GEAR RISING: REVENGEANCE
notes: Game works only in windowed mode. If set fullscreen the window becomes black

title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance
notes: Intro Chapter works fine. Cutscene into first Chapter and first fight (where you get ambushed by 3 soldiers) works fine but the cutscene the end of the fight triggers crashes the game

title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance
notes: Performance it self is fine, but right before the R-01: Mistral boss fight, the graphic gliches begin to appear and in the last phase of the boss battle it becomes unplayable due to graphical glitches.

Played in windowed mode, 1280x720. Other graphics settings at default for "High" on "Graphic Quality" (the master setting). Played through the whole main game, both DLCs, and all VR missions. Beat the main game on every difficulty. 50 hours total playtime. For the most part, everything seemed to work perfectly. Steam was in Offline Mode for most of it (see bug #3). Did not try any tweaks.

Bugs encountered:

1. Hitting "Continue" after pausing cutscenes only advanced one frame, though you could still "Skip" them.

2. Would often get a lot of static on my speakers after playing for a few hours.  Re-launching the game fixed it. I use an Encore USB Audio Box, detected as a "CM106 Like Sound Device Analog Stero" (it's chipset or whatever, I assume).  Switching to the onboard audio (Realtek ALC1150) cut down on the amount of static, but didn't prevent the issue.  My OS uses the Pulse Audio Controller that came with it by default.

3. Had my entire system freeze up on me twice during play. Upon resetting and relaunching, the Steam client applied an update (the only times that happened while I was testing this), so apparently that somehow caused it. Had to completely disable my network connection to prevent it since the Steam client will still update even in offline mode.
systemInfoNotes: I use the XFCE version of Mint, specifically
title: METAL GEAR RISING: REVENGEANCE

notes: Stable 60FPS, no crashes or graphical glitches, but VERY broken mouse camera (not sure about controllers, don't have any to test)
